intro: Phyllanthus cecilfischeri, commonly known as the Cecil Fischer's spurge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, waxy leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
